sentences.sContent: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
sentences.sCn: 近年来，这种病的患者人数明显下降。

sentences.sContent: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
sentences.sCn: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

sentences.sContent: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
...there are higher levels of stress hormones in their bodies which can decrease immune function...
...The result has been a decrease in the number of American college graduates who have the skills...
...Recent reports found that lodging with a student of a different race may decrease prejudice and compel students to engage in more ethnically diverse friendships...

remMethod.val: de(变慢) ＋ cre(生长) ＋ ase → 减少

trans.tranOther: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less
